definition: generic word for peoples or states of south China or south Asia at different historical periods/abbr. for Vietnam 越南
to exceed/to climb over/to surpass/the more... the more
position/location/place/seat/classifier for people (honorific)/classifier for binary bits (e.g. 十六位 16-bit or 2 bytes)/(physics) potential

sentences.english: Building offside tactics is one kind when use regulation and design defends tactics.
sentences.chinese: 造越位戰術是利用規則而設計的一種防守戰術。

sentences.english: Alas, there’s no audio commentary so the offside rule remains a mystery.
sentences.chinese: 唉，因爲沒有現場語音解說，越位判定仍然是一個謎。

sentences.english: That lad [Filippo Inzaghi] must have been born offside.
sentences.chinese: 因扎吉那傢伙肯定是生下來就越位的。

sentences.english: 'I didn't turn to see the linesman because for me I was onside.
sentences.chinese: 我並沒有注重邊裁是否舉旗，因爲我知道我沒有越位。

sentences.english: This is a goal scored from an off-side position .
The England U16 international had another two goals chalked off for offside.
sentences.chinese: 這名英格蘭U16的國腳還有兩個進球被判越位。

sentences.english: When the decisive goal is waived offside by another incorrect lines-blind.
sentences.chinese: 當一個決定性的進球被另一個瞎子吹成了越位。

sentences.english: The goal was called offside by the referee.
sentences.chinese: 那個進球被裁判判爲越位。

sentences.english: The Baggies immediately bounced back, however, and had a goal disallowed for offside, shortly before actually equalising from the penalty spot.
sentences.chinese: 西布朗很快反攻，不過他們的進球因爲越位不算。

sentences.english: Thee goal was called offside by the referee.
sentences.chinese: 那個進球被裁判判爲越位。

sentences.english: This is a goal scored from an off-side position. The referee refused to allow it.
sentences.chinese: 這是個越位進球，裁判宣佈該進球無效。

sentences.english: Stopped players moving back into onside positions at unrealistically fast speed.
sentences.chinese: 消滅了球員會以光速往回跑到不越位的位置的情況。

sentences.english: Both of our strikers could see that the other was clearly onside .
sentences.chinese: 我們兩個前鋒都很明顯的沒有越位。

sentences.english: There was absolutely no doubt about the offside, even a child could have seen that both players were offside.
sentences.chinese: 這是毫無爭議的越位，就連小孩子站邊上也能看得出。

sentences.english: And then an Argentinean goal against Mexico was given, despite the striker being offside.
sentences.chinese: 阿根廷前鋒踢進墨西哥的的越位球卻算進。

definition: corner kick (in soccer)/free strike in hockey
to burst or force open a door/to excommunicate sb (from the Roman Catholic Church)/to score a goal (in football, hockey etc)
(soccer, handball etc) to kick or shoot the ball towards the goal
to misjudge/error of judgment/incorrect ruling/miscarriage of justice
to scout for a tour operator/to reconnoiter a potential tour itinerary/(tennis) to commit a foot fault
